elements.title: Mary Earle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mary Earle (pictured) was born near Ben Nevis, and although she became a professor of food technology in New Zealand, she never forgot her Scottish roots?

elements.title: Siamés (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the electropop rock band Siamés created "Argentina's first anime music video"?

elements.title: The Icepick Surgeon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the book The Icepick Surgeon discusses research by Henry Murray in which he verbally abused volunteers, one of whom went on to become the Unabomber?

elements.title: Agnieszka Rehlis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Polish mezzo-soprano Agnieszka Rehlis, who sang in the Grammy Award–winning album Penderecki conducts Penderecki, was Verdi's Azucena in Zürich in 2021?

elements.title: Parankylosauria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that species in the dinosaur group Parankylosauria have tail weaponry termed a "macuahuitl", in reference to the Mesoamerican weapons of the same name?

elements.title: Pat Studstill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pat Studstill led the National Football League in punt return yards in 1962, receiving yards in 1966, and punting yards in 1969?

elements.title: Dutch invasion of Saint Helena (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first landing during the Dutch invasion of Saint Helena was defeated by English settlers throwing rocks?

elements.title: KBIM-TV (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when the founder of New Mexico television station KBIM-TV was told on the morning of April Fools' Day that his station's tower had collapsed, he initially wrote it off as a joke?
